title: Frankenstein; or, The Modern Prometheus
author: Mary Shelley
description: A groundbreaking Gothic‑horror novel that tells the story of Dr. Victor Frankenstein, a scientist who assembles a living being from dead body parts — and then recoils in horror when his ‘creation’ awakens. The novel explores themes of ambition, the ethics of creation, identity, social rejection, and humanity. Considered one of the first science‑fiction novels and a classic of 19th‑century literature. 336–352 pages depending on edition. First published anonymously; later editions credited Mary Shelley. :contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}
